title: Customize the "About This Mac" Window With Whatever Information You Want
text:
If you’re a Hackintosh user , you know the About This Mac window on your Mac often contains errors about what hardware you have installed. Over on iDownloadBlog, they show you how to manually edit the details to include whatever you want.
The Always Up-to-Date Guide to Building a Hackintosh (macOS Sierra) The Always Up-to-Date Guide to Building a Hackintosh (macOS Sierra) The Always Up-to-Date Guide to Building a… Building a hackintosh—that is, installing macOS on non-Apple hardware—used to require extremely… Read more Read more
While there is some fun stuff in here, like changing the system logo, most of the reason for doing this would be most useful for Hackintosh users so you can keep track of the hardware in your computer. You’ll do this by editing a PLIST file where you can change details like computer name, add processor info, or change the graphics card listing. Obviously if your Hackintosh is recognizing all this stuff automatically it’s not useful, but if not, this is a fun way to cram those details into the section they’re supposed to be in. Head over to iDownloadBlog for the full guide.
